[SYNTAX]: Overly complex sentence structures (e.g., "Following the swaying tapestried box-like chairs...")
[GRAMMAR]: Tense inconsistency ("the day outside is dark" vs. past tense context)

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt, unrelated paragraphs (e.g., "No uncertainty...", "Leicester Square...") disrupting narrative flow
[TRANSITION]: Sudden, unmarked shift from jewel scene to memory flashback without resolution
[LOGIC]: Non-sequitur about family statistics ("Families are restricted...")

[LEXICON]: Occasionally formal or archaic phrasing (e.g., "in the foreign way," "spirit of freedom that lit the eyes").

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt, unconnected introduction of Jeanne Poissonâ€™s backstory without transitional link to preceding narrative.
